infos.value: I have spoken with the village chief. He says to stay as long as we please.
I see. Then let us depart.
P-please wait! If we are not staying, then why did we come to the village?
Did you not hear me? We are leaving the village.
What is King Oelde thinking?
The enemy must know we've entered the village.
If that's the case, they're likely planning an attack on the village.
You can't mean... King Oelde intends to buy us some time by sacrificing these people!?
I-I cannot allow it! Such a heartless...!
I know. I understand how you feel, but...
You cannot defy your father...
So I shall go in your stead.
That's madness!
I am well aware. But if my life can save several others'...
Lord Mont... Can't you try to persuade King Oelde somehow?
I'll... I'll go.
What!? N-no, you can't!
Schuzelt has opened my eyes to the truth.
You know, the people of this village saved my life once.
It happened when I visited Wezette as an envoy.
My men and I fled to this village one night as we were pursued by a pack of murderous bandits.
If they hadn't helped us, I wouldn't be here right now.
That's why...
I will go by your side.
No, Schuzelt. Your wounds are not yet healed.
This little scratch?
That's no scratch. You're staying right here.
I'll go in your place.
You have my thanks, Lilyth.
Then let's go, before King Oelde finds us...
What are you doing?
Where are Mont and Lilyth?
They left the village to attack the pursuing Fennes troops.
Damn those half-wits...
